questions.question: A global application needs static IPs, low-latency routing, and fast failover between Regions. Which service best fits?
options: Elastic Load Balancer with cross-zone disabled
questions.explanation: Global Accelerator provides anycast static IPs, health-based failover, and accelerates to the closest edge; pairing with CloudFront handles cached content.

questions.question: You need deterministic, low-jitter connectivity from on-prem to multiple VPCs with minimal AWS management overhead. What is the best pattern?
options: VPN over the internet to each VPC
VPC peering mesh across all VPCs
Transit Gateway attached to a Direct Connect gateway
PrivateLink endpoints in each VPC for on-prem
questions.explanation: Transit Gateway with a DX gateway centralizes connectivity, scales, and reduces operational complexity while meeting performance needs.

questions.question: Which approach reduces latency for API calls from South America users to a single us-east-1 backend without creating a new Region?
options: Enable CloudFront with regional edge caches
questions.explanation: CloudFront with regional edge caches accelerates dynamic and static delivery by terminating TLS closer to users and reusing edge connections.
